channel.title: Sprint Toggle
channel.description: i think it would be a good idea if you could put a sprint toggle ( to make like when you always sprinted in hl1) in the game to make it more like the original. like if the toggle was on, press shit to stop sprinting (hl1) or toggle sprint off and you walk all the time and sprint with shift (like hl2)

item.title: Sprint Toggle
item.dc:creator: fury
item.description:
JamesKane:

oh we want the game to be fast and crazy like the old school games.

awesome. the thing is, i think making the run-speed faster won’t do it.

edit: bhop is important for gameplay balance, because you can either be slow (run around) and shoot accurately or be mega fast and shoot less accurate (except you play like a god).

Read full topic

item.description:
oh we want the game to be fast and crazy like the old school games.

Read full topic

item.title: Sprint Toggle
item.dc:creator: fury
item.description:
TheeGoatPig:

Yay? I hate games ruled by “pro gamers”. They exploit the worst parts of the game to make it as little fun for everyone else around them as possible. I say, “Fuck them,” and close up every exploit and bug you can find.

everybody has the same chances… and can go pro. further… there will always be better and lower skilled people playing a game, so there is no point in removing all challenging parts of a game.
for me… games have to be challenging… otherwise it’s no fun to master them… and i mean that for singleplayer games same as for multiplayer games.

btw. black mesa is a remake of half-life 1… and half-life 1 is no noob game… so i hope the devs will take care about that and make the game faithful… multiplayer games (especially deathmatch games) without rampant learning curves will die after a while, because they get boring… because of the lack of challenges and excitement.

Read full topic

item.title: Sprint Toggle

item.description:
I like you, you make sense. :freeman:

Read full topic

item.title: Sprint Toggle
item.dc:creator: TheeGoatPig
item.description:
xtobix:

in my opinion removing bhop from hl (with the lack of bhop in bm:dm) it would be the same like removing hotkeys from starcraft2… no pro would play it.

Yay? I hate games ruled by “pro gamers”. They exploit the worst parts of the game to make it as little fun for everyone else around them as possible. I say, “Fuck them,” and close up every exploit and bug you can find.

Read full topic

item.title: Sprint Toggle
item.dc:creator: fury
item.description:
sersoft:

if black mesa deathmatch is good enough people will find new exploits, but they can’t just keep the old ones, especially considering they’re already fixed by the EP2 engine

btw… even css has a bhop on/off command for servers.

edit: if you don’t believe me… look up counter-strike source’s update history from 17th Aug 2010:

Community Requests:
Added cvar sv_enablebunnyhopping, defaulted to 0. ( A value of 1 autotags the server with “bunnyhop” )

further… this is no real argument for me. bhop isn’t just a bug. it’s a gameplay element, also. it improves the quality of the game. imagine quake live without bhop. nobody would play it. it would be a cheap noob game.

Read full topic

item.title: Sprint Toggle
item.dc:creator: fury
item.description:
JamesKane:

Undetermined at this time. However, you may be forced to always run as we would like DM to be fast.

the reason why i want to see bhop and climbing(russian-duck) or a bigger stepsize:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=BVgqj2j1Fe0&tracker=False

edit 1: don’t be lame and tell me this is unrealistic. this is hl and it roxx this way. it’s just amazing speed, control and advanced gameplay. btw… even css has a bhop on/off command for servers.

edit 2: in my opinion removing bhop from hl (with the lack of bhop in bm:dm) it would be the same like removing hotkeys from starcraft2… no pro would play it. it would make the game slow, unexciting and uncompfortable to play.

Read full topic

item.title: Sprint Toggle
item.dc:creator: JamesKane
item.description:
Solokiller:

I figure it’s not that hard to create an alias that essentially toggles between running and walking, but since it’s a server CVAR it would probably be cheat protected in multiplayer, or isn’t it?

Undetermined at this time. However, you may be forced to always run as we would like DM to be fast.

Read full topic

item.title: Sprint Toggle
item.dc:creator: JamesKane
item.description:
EdwardR:

You run by auto in HL1, but still. There are no AUXes. Why? Because in HL1 you use Mark IV HEV, Not Mark V from HL2. So… no AUXes!

We found it silly to have aux power for the flashlight and sprinting.

Read full topic

item.title: Sprint Toggle
item.dc:creator: Jethrosoup
item.description:
JamesKane:

sv_always_run 1/0

If on then you always run and you use shift to walk.
If off then you always walk and you use shift to run.

Key binding for great victory!

Read full topic

BMS: So secretive, even the menu options are under media blackout.

item.description:
It would be nice if there were a crouch toggle in SP. My pinky gets cramps without it.

Read full topic

item.title: Sprint Toggle
item.dc:creator: JamesKane
item.description:
xtobix:

i hope you will have the following key-binds/settings in there:

-climb key: In HL1 i climbed up small crates by walking against them and spamming crouch-key rly fast… so you were able to use the russian-duck to climb up small crates. It was faster and easier to control.

-long jump key: one key for performing a forward longjump (aka. silent longjump script)

-edgefriction settings…

-mp_bunnyhop on/off

  1. Yes we have a jump key.
  2. nope
  3. nope
  4. no bunny hopping in sp

Read full topic

item.title: Sprint Toggle
item.dc:creator: fury
item.description:
JamesKane:

It mimics the options menu. The game options menu ( not the options menu ) can include any console variable and add new tabs with ease just by modifying a single file. It contains many features controlled by console variables like the sprint/walk issue.

i hope you will have the following key-binds/settings in there:

-climb key: In HL1 i climbed up small crates by walking against them and spamming crouch-key rly fast… so you were able to use the russian-duck to climb up small crates. It was faster and easier to control.

-long jump key: one key for performing a forward longjump (aka. silent longjump script)

-edgefriction settings…

-mp_bunnyhop on/off

Read full topic
